com.dotcms.publisher.endpoint.business

Interface PublishingEndPointAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PublishingEndPointAPIImpl

    public interface PublishingEndPointAPI
    API for EndPoints management.
    Author:
    Graziano Aliberti - Engineering Ingegneria Informatica S.p.a Oct 26, 2012 - 9:54:57 AM

    • Method Detail

      • getAllEndPoints

        java.util.List<PublishingEndPoint> getAllEndPoints()
                                                   throws DotDataException
        Returns all endPoints configured into the system. All endPoints are returned regardless of whether or not they are enabled.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • getReceivingEndPoints

        java.util.List<PublishingEndPoint> getReceivingEndPoints()
                                                         throws DotDataException
        Returns receiving endPoints configured into the system. All endPoints where (isSending() == false) are returned.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • findEndPointById

        PublishingEndPoint findEndPointById(java.lang.String id)
                                    throws DotDataException
        Returns the single endPoint by id. If an endPoint is not found matching id then null is returned.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • findEndPointByName

        PublishingEndPoint findEndPointByName(java.lang.String name)
                                      throws DotDataException
        Returns the single endPoint by serverName. If an endPoint is not found matching serverName then null is returned.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • findEnabledSendingEndPointByAddress

        PublishingEndPoint findEnabledSendingEndPointByAddress(java.lang.String address)
                                                       throws DotDataException
        Returns enabled, receiving endPoint that matches the provided address. If a match is not found, null is returned. To be returned, the endPoint must have the matching address, be enabled, and be configured as sending. If an endPoint does not match all three criteria, null is returned.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • findSendingEndPointsByEnvironment

        java.util.List<PublishingEndPoint> findSendingEndPointsByEnvironment(java.lang.String environmentId)
                                                                     throws DotDataException
        Returns a List with the sending endPoints related to the given environmentId. If no match is found, an empty List is returned.
        Parameters:
        environmentId -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • getEnabledReceivingEndPoints

        java.util.List<PublishingEndPoint> getEnabledReceivingEndPoints()
                                                                throws DotDataException
        Returns all enabled receiving endPoints. All endPoints where (endPoint.isEnabled() && isSending() == false) are returned.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • saveEndPoint

        void saveEndPoint(PublishingEndPoint anEndPoint)
                  throws DotDataException
        Save a new endPoint.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • updateEndPoint

        void updateEndPoint(PublishingEndPoint anEndPoint)
                    throws DotDataException
        Update endPoint.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

        void deleteEndPointById(java.lang.String id)
                        throws DotDataException
        Delete endPoint by identifier.
        Throws:
        DotDataException
